SENT.plain: Magnetic resonance (MR) images of nine patients with intracranial vertebral artery occlusion (five proved, four presumed) have been reviewed
In two of nine, both vertebral arteries were occluded and in five of the nine, the basilar artery was also blocked
All occluded arteries showed absence of flow void and were clearly demonstrated as mildly hypo- approximately mildly hyperintense structures to brainstem parenchyma on the T1-weighted images
In two of five patients with basilar artery occlusion, retrograde filling of the distal basilar artery was detected
Thus, MR imaging, in particular the T1-weighted image, is a pertinent diagnostic modality for evaluating intracranial vertebral artery occlusion
Angiography does not seem to be required for confirmation
